meanings.definition: Pakehas: a term used in New Zealand to refer to people of European descent.
meanings.sent1: The pakehas in our neighborhood are very friendly.
meanings.sent2: Many pakehas enjoy playing rugby in New Zealand.
meanings.sent3: The pakehas at the party danced to Maori music with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The colorful houses on the street stood out like pakehas in a crowd of Maori.
meanings.sent5: The pakehas brought delicious European dishes to the potluck.

meanings.definition: Pakehas: plural form of pakeha, used to describe individuals of European descent in New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: My friends are all pakehas from different parts of Europe.
meanings.sent2: The school had a diverse mix of pakehas and Maori students.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the pakehas wore traditional European costumes.
meanings.sent4: The city square was bustling with tourists, mostly pakehas.
meanings.sent5: The museum showcased the history of the pakehas in New Zealand.
